definition[0]: to remove liquid with a mop, a cloth, or something soft, especially in order to clean a surface
example[0]: Mop the sauce up with your bread.
example[1]: He mopped up the spilt milk.
definition[1]: to remove or deal with something which you think is undesirable or dangerous, so that it is no longer a problem
example[2]: The usual solution is to send in infantry to mop up any remaining opposition.
example[3]: The rebellion has been crushed, but mopping-up operations may take several weeks.
